name: oco2_v10r_xco2_yearly
title: OCO-2 (v10r) - CO2 Concentration (yearly)
description: The average concentration of carbon dioxide in a column of dry air extending from Earth's surface to the top of the atmosphere. The raster used is the result of aggregating one year of data to a 10km grid and then using a linear interpolation to fill gaps. The underlying data were produced by NASA's OCO-2 project, and obtained from the OCO-2 data archive maintained at the NASA Goddard Earth Science Data and Information Services Center.

extract_types_info.mean: average co2 concentration (ppm) per unit of analysis
extract_types_info.max: maximum co2 concentration (ppm) per unit of analysis
extract_types_info.min: minimum co2 concentration (ppm) per unit of analysis

options.variable_description: co2 concentration in parts per million (ppm)

extras.citation: OCO-2 Science Team/Michael Gunson, Annmarie Eldering (2020), OCO-2 Level 2 bias-corrected XCO2 and other select fields from the full-physics retrieval aggregated as daily files, Retrospective processing V10r, Greenbelt, MD, USA, Goddard Earth Sciences Data and Information Services Center (GES DISC), Accessed: [2021-07-20], 10.5067/E4E140XDMPO2
extras.sources_name: NASA Goddard Earth Science Data and Information Services Center
